title: Who to Follow Online
content:
Who to Follow Online
- Nicholas Diakopoulos. Professor at Northwestern University and Director of the Computational Journalism Lab (CJL) and their newsletter, Generative AI in the Newsroom.
- Ethan Mollick. Excellent at translating generative AI into practical newsroom and storytelling workflows.
- Charlie Beckett. Director at LSE's Polis; writes clearly about AI, power, trust, and journalism ethics.
- Rasmus Kleis Nielsen. Focuses on how audiences, platforms, and AI reshape journalism economics and trust.
- Bettina Peters. Strong on newsroom AI adoption, governance, and real-world constraints.
- Simon Rogers. Deep experience in data-driven storytelling and automation at scale.
- Meredith Broussard. Essential counterweight to hype; strong on why AI often fails journalists and communities.
- Anya Schiffrin. Focuses on media sustainability, regulation, and AI's political consequences.
- Chris Moran. One of the best public thinkers inside a major broadcaster on AI experimentation.
- Emily Bell. Columbia Journalism School; essential reading on platforms, AI, and media power.
